Job Description:
Description

GALE is a business agency that brings together consulting expertise & agency creativity. We work without silos to deliver innovative business strategy, data insights, and transformative creative work.

GALE is a global company with offices located in New York, Austin, Toronto, Singapore and Bengaluru.

About The Role

This is a senior UX product designer role. You will need experience concepting, ideating, and delivering design solutions, as well as collaborating with partners in technology and strategy.

Your portfolio will demonstrate an ability to understand the underlying business problem and develop innovative, customer centered design solutions across different platforms, devices and locations.

Who You Are
 Love working with a team on a mission and are at your best when collaborating to find elegant and practical solutions to tough design challenges You think by doing  sketching and prototyping to generate ideas and simplify the finished product By merging design, data & consumer insights you are always pushing your ideas beyond best practices Minimum 4 years of experience designing digital experiences Proficient in tools like Figma or FramerX to build digital assets and create prototypes Prior experience in product design will be an asset Knowledge and experience in FE development would be a big plus 

Requirements
 Using a variety of tools and techniques brainstorm, iterate, and document digital experiences, including creating user flows, heuristic evaluations, develop prototypes, and conduct user tests to optimize the solution. Be an SME in regards to UX best practices, upcoming trends and how to make impactful designs drawing upon those concepts

Role: UX Designer




Electrical Energy keeps the world moving. No matter where the power comes from or where it needs to go we make sure it makes its way.

Can you help us shape the future? Were looking for dedicated people with the skills and vision to build a better tomorrow. Join our Smart Grids and Infrastructure team as a UX Designer and help us create the technology that will transform entire industries, cities and even countries.

What will the future look like? What can we look forward to? We dont know for sure. Thats why we need true pioneers who, while exploring the world of research and development, trigger innovative projects and come up with unusual paths towards a solution  our drive to make the impossible possible has no limits! This is your chance: drive global change with us.

We make real what matters?

Apply design thinking to deliver end-to-end user experience solutions with a focus on user needs and business goals.Expertise in design user interfaces based on exploration of interaction design concepts and refinement of design through an iterative process.Responsible for delivering all aspects of design, from defining customer needs to delivering concepts and prototypes to UI specifications for development.Best Utilization of industry design standards and practices to define and implement design criteria, design guidelines, and design specifications.Collaborate closely with Project Lead, Project Manager and development team in planning, prioritizing, requirements analysis, task analysis, conceptual modeling, interaction design, and usability testing.Produce user requirements specifications, personas, storyboards, scenarios, user flow diagrams, wireframes, design prototypes, and design specifications.

Use your skills to move the world forward!

We need a B.E/B. Tech graduate in any branch of engineering or in Design with 4 to 6 Years of experience in Interaction design for Web and Mobile applicationsHands on expertise in using tools such as Abode XD, Photoshop, illustrator, Axure, SketchProficiency with UX design process, Lean UX methodologies will make valuable contributionsKnowledge with HTML, CSS and JavaScript and Certifications in Interaction Design, UX design or Human computer Interaction is an advantage.Possess excellent facilitation, presentation and interpersonal skills will make valuable contributions.

Weve got quite a lot to offer. How about you?




This role is based in Bangalore. Youll also get to visit other locations in India and beyond, so youll need to go where this journey takes you. In return, youll get the chance to work with teams impacting entire cities, countries  and the shape of things to come.

Were Siemens. A collection of over 379,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we encourage applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us craft tomorrow.




Find out more about Siemens careers at: www.siemens.com/careers

Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from India due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum qualifications:
 Master's degree in design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or a related field.  8 years of experience in a related field.  Experience designing responsive, web-based interfaces. Experience in design systems and designing web component libraries. 

Preferred qualifications:
 Ecommerce or retail design experience.  Ability to effectively communicate with a project team. Strong HTML, Javascript, prototyping (Framer, etc.), visual design skills. 

About The Job

Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, youll take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the worldfrom the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design processfrom creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.

Google Store is the online retail destination for the hardware and solutions created by Google, including Pixel phones, Pixelbook laptops, Google Nest home devices, and more. Our team of talented, fun, and experienced designers, researchers, and engineers shares a culture of collaborative work, where we apply a data-driven process to create the next generation of retail experiences. We collaborate closely with marketing, brand, product, services, and engineering teams operating in 35 countries around the world.

Responsibilities Drive our team's design thinking across diverse product releases, platforms, and devices. Develop high-level and detailed wireframes, low- and high-fidelity mockups, detailed microinteraction matrices, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas. Evaluate usability of existing flows and recommend thoughtful design changes when appropriate. Deliver coherent and delightful UX concepts, along with a plan for evolutionary, iterative updates, that actualize the larger vision over time. Build strong relationships and operating rhythms to efficiently implement user experiences that are cohesive, inclusive, and well-informed. Be responsible for and effectively advocate for users in a fast-paced work environment, imparting day-to-day design leadership that fosters a shared understanding of the user-centric intersection between design, content, business, and engineering. 

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

About SpotDraft:

SpotDraft is an AI-driven, end-to-end contract automation platform that helps organizations create, analyze, negotiate, sign, store & manage contracts seamlessly, and get automated reminders about upcoming actions. Were currently actively expanding our footprint in India, US, Canada, UK & Singapore. SpotDraft is used by big brands such as Nomura and HDFC, as well as fast-growing global startups like Whatfix, Wingify, Unabiz, Assembly Payments, and many more. The company is backed by top investors like 500 Startups, Singapore Angel Network & successful entrepreneurs such as founders of Flipkart & Freshworks, amongst others. www.spotdraft.com

As a UX Designer at SpotDraft, you will work in a high growth environment & will be a part of the Product team. You will be working closely with Product and Engineering. You will learn and collaborate with a team of highly talented people who have previously worked in multiple industries.

Role & Responsibilities

Take a user-centered design approach to create user flows, user journeys, screen flows, wireframe specifications, and other necessary documentation to communicate the recommended user experienceTest the flows, screen implementations, copy/content, to ensure the end customers experience is top-notch and iterate designsObsess over customer experience, simplicity & information architecture
Qualifications & Skills:

Minimum 1 year of full-time experience in a similar roleA penchant for creating simple solutions for complex workflows & processes. Prior experience conducting usability testing exercises & iterating your solution based on what is learned from these exercises. A good sense of visual (typography, color theory & visual hierarchy) and interaction skills (micro-interactions & animations)The ability to clearly & effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutionsA solid understanding of user-centered design principles, careful attention to detail, as well as the ability to grasp multiple requirementsProficiency with design and prototyping tools - Adobe Creative SuiteHave an impeccable taste and a compulsive eye for detailA strong ability to work autonomously as well as part of a teamThe ability to quickly deliver strong designs during rapid, iterative processes and multitask in a fast-paced environmentA growth mindset
Why SpotDraft?

Were building a great product, and we are genuinely excited to take it to the world! It is possibly the best time to join. The team is lean and still growing. There are endless opportunities to show immediate impact, build processes/products from scratch, and do things youve not done before.Building and selling to an international audience - which is always a great experience to have!Amazing teammates, great work culture & flat hierarchy. SpotDraft is an equal opportunity employer.

JOB DESCRIPTION 
 Exp Range: 3-9 yrs Location: Bangalore 
 Strong and capable engagement in standard UX processes. An established performer with strong communication skills who proactively builds relationships and is a key contributor to improvements in designs and processes. Can work independently or within a cross functional team under specific creative direction, existing style guides and frameworks to create sketches, wireframes, user flows, visuals, prototypes and /or other interface specifications. Contributes to coherent visual and interaction designs across flows and channels. Given specific problem or product areas can provide specific solution efforts Impact is assessed at the solution and team contribution level. Part of a team they have been assigned to. Doesn't take requirements as a given. Assures there's a human perspective in opportunity and solution. Emerging recognition that it's not all about UX, but how UX contributes to a broader goal. Recognizes business goals and technical complexities. Challenges status quo with clear rationale and competitive, business or user insights. Works with UX team members, product managers and engineers. Actively contributes to cross-functional sessions. Confident in applying best practices to common design problems. Solutions are solid if not novel without guidance of manager, team lead or design director. Builds new networks of professional colleagues Refers people in their professional network to build team and skills. Confidently communicates decision-making rationale to team members 
 
Core Skills Strong in both core visual and interaction design skills with solid technical capabilities in prototyping, font-end presentation technology and user centred design methods. All previous skills plus: Challenges status quo with clear rationale. Understands differences and similarities of design systems/platforms. Applies mobile-first design strategies. Communicates insights that led to design recommendations. Designs meaningful transitions between views or states. Infuses meaning with high level of polish. Uses components and patterns appropriately. Explains visual design decisions using design principles. Understands technical constraints of solutions. Understands generally what HTML/CSS and native UI frameworks can and cant do. Chooses appropriate tags and rules for style and layout. Has understanding of user-centred research practices and participates in customer centric design processes

About Trell
Trell is building Indias largest lifestyle-community-commerce platform for the next 500 million internet users.
Our vision is to empower Indians to have a better lifestyle. Fondly referred to as the regional Pinterest for India powered by user-generated original content, we have built a highly engaged community of 45 million users who share new ideas, experiences, and product recommendations with each other in various Indian languages. It is currently present in 7 lifestyle categories-beauty, personal care, fashion, cooking, movies & web series reviews, gadgets, and travel.
Today, there is a dearth of meaningful and relatable content that helps Indian language internet users with lifestyle discovery and purchase decision making. The community on Trell shares original videos and blogs on new ideas, experiences, product recommendations, and reviews with each other in multiple Indian languages. Every month, a community of 25 million Monthly Active Users creates more than 2 million content pieces, garnering over 2 billion views, and is impacting millions of Indians in making better lifestyle choices. Trell, which will enable its creators to monetize their content in the future, aims to be Indias largest community-commerce platform by 2021
Our CultureAt Trell, we ignite passion and performance to work towards a collective goal: creating the perfect mobile entertainment ecosystem that delivers the best possible experience to millions of users around the world. Our default mode is that of perpetual innovation. Together, we form a concerted rhythm that goes beyond borders. We don't just go with the flow, we create it.Trell offers a dynamic and unconventional work environment, full of fun wholesome experiences. We believe creativity and technology blend together, when you choose Trell, you join a diverse world of high-calibre techies, and inventors hailing from varied companies.Our value-based, people-first work culture is about empowering every individual in our team to be catalysts for change in this dynamic digital world. Every day is an opportunity to bring your vision to life, to expand, learn and grow. No idea is left unconsidered. No voice is left unheard.With users speaking multiple languages in India, we like to think we have the most diverse user base. We believe different is wonderful, and what sets us apart is also what brings us closer. Trell prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We have committed ourselves to create a safe environment with fair and equal access and opportunities, sans discrimination. We encourage everyone to be open to experiences and perspectives beyond their normal; divergent thinkers create differentiated products and an even better product.If our vibe matches with yours, we'd love to hear from you.
Responsibilities
Create and refine comprehensive UX flows for Trells app and websiteWork with users and product teams to test, evaluate, and iterate on product features.Monitor and analyze data, how well existing interfaces work, and where they fall short.Clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions.Mentor, support and inspire other designers. Stay updated on the latest developments, trends, and thinking within design and technology, and share your knowledge and thoughts with team members.Ship valuable and high-quality work without sacrificing speed.Youll own projects from start to finish while leading various UX initiatives including running design sprints to define and explore and leading stakeholder reviews.
Required Skills
Experience designing complex yet intuitive applications for mobile and webExcellent communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate design decisionsProficiency in simplifying complex information for users.Proficiency in creating design deliverables like wireframes, mockups, prototypes etc.Proficiency with Sketch/ Figma, and Adobe Suite of applications3+ years of relevant experience with an M.Des./ PGDPD or equivalent, or 5+ years of relevant experience with B.Des./ GDPD or equivalent.
Checklist for Ideal CandidateYou should have an excellent eye for detailYou've shipped something across several platforms. You know what translates from desktop and what doesn't, or why you'd opt for one solution for iOS and another on Android.You know how to contribute to defining the what as well as the how.You are a hustler and believe in transparency of thought and actionYou believe strongly in pursuing the principle of Design Thinking

Roles & Responsibilities
Adobe Design is seeking a Senior Experience Designer to join our Business & Administrative team. Were looking for thought leaders with enterprise experience who can help craft the big picture while never losing sight of important details. This person will concept, plan, and deliver end-to-end user experiences and next-generation workflows that will help define how Enterprises & SMBs utilize Adobes solutions. The ideal candidate should possess an excellent sense of creative strategy that enables them to communicate, negotiate, and drive design solutions for our products.
What youll be working on
Translate complex design problems, user pain points, and research findings into practical and impactful design solutionsProactively engage with multiple project stakeholders, including product managers, engineers, and other designers, in drafting and brainstorming initial conceptsQuickly visualize and prototype ideas to communicate concepts, conveying design ideas via sketches, wireframes, hi-fidelity mockups, prototypes, and/or animationsConduct primary and/or secondary research, as well as quick rounds of usability testsCreate iterative designs that meet product objectives, fit within Adobe Design guidelines, and respond to feedback and usability testingStrive to elevate the product by crafting elegant visual design systems from modern UI patterns and trends, from concept to executionSupport and collaborate with development teams throughout the implementation cycleArticulate strategy behind design decisions and participate in regular peer reviews.Be an advocate for the user & lead by example.
Ideal Candidate
What youll bring to the team
5+ years experience in UX design with a proven track record of success, including 3 or more years with enterprise products or servicesAbility to clearly articulate a problem space and design solutions that meet users needs and business goalsAbility to quickly incorporate feedback and efficiently produce high quality professional workAbility to think holistically about how the UI will scale in the future and integrate with other systemsExperience conducting and analyzing user researchStrong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skillsAbility to accurately set, manage, and meet deadlinesComfortable working in a loosely defined agile and lean design environmentSkilled in design software such as Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar tools.

Description

You will work with a small design team that is passionate about building awesome products for API developers and consumers. You should be comfortable working closely with super talented Postman engineers while being in touch at all times with the people who use Postman. We understand that the greatest user experiences take several iterations (and experiments) to develop and were looking for a designer who will enjoy the design process as much as we do.

Responsibilities
 Produce design deliverables consistent with Postman design and brand standards, analytics insights and customer feedback. Be involved with all parts of the product cycle from ideation, design and development to testing. Continuous social listening through twitter, github and zendesk to better understand how people use Postman. 

Requirements
 You have an eye for well-designed, functional products (physical and digital) You can visually communicate an idea by creating quick, low fidelity mockups such as pencil sketches. You can create high fidelity mockups and prototypes to articulate detailed screen flows and user interactions that need to be developed. Good at collaborating across teams and locations, especially remote work across two offices and time zones. Comfortable using the latest design mockup and prototyping tools. We arent rigid about design tools though, so we are open to suggestions always. A good understanding of how APIs work and what Postman does is important. Its okay if youre not an expert as long as you take initiative and are excited to learn about how things work together. 

Benefits

This position will be located in Postmans beautiful office at 100 ft road, Indiranagar in Bangalore, where youll find our fantastic perks including: complimentary meals and snacks, game room, ergonomic workstations, flexible hours, and endless cuddles from our endearing Chief Happiness Officer, Cooper (Cooper is a dog, by the way).

At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency and honest communication about not only successes, but also mistakes. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision as we continue to move forward. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.

And we want you to be part of it all.

Introduction

Anatta is an ecommerce agency that helps digitally native brands be their best selves. In more than 10 years of operation we've been lucky enough to work with some incredible brands, including WeWork, Rothy's, Four Sigmatic, Berkey Filters, NutriBullet, Smartypants Vitamins, Kettle & Fire, Koss, Dr. Mark Hyman, Marie Forleo and scores more.

As we hope you'll discover over the next couple of minutes, we're a passionate bunch here at Anatta. We love the work we do, and we strive to wow our clients with everything we deliver.

In order to do that, we make sure we never stand still. We're always on top of the latest trends so that we can provide our clients with truly unrivaled services and solutions.

Ultimately, we try to improve as a business each and every day

And that's where you come in!

We're looking for a junior or entry level UX designer who has a design or technology background that is wanting to gain experience working with our user experience design team, specifically in the eCommerce field. You'll get to work daily with our developers, project managers, and clients to implement meaningful solutions with pixel-perfect designs.

Close collaboration is a big part of what makes us at Anatta different, so you'll be spending a lot of time working closely with our customers so it would be great if you thrive in client-facing situations. Among other things, you'll learn how to work alongside Anatta colleagues and shadow some of our senior designers and developers as they work with our customer stakeholders to design cohesive and creative user experiences, construct customer personas, and map out product / service lifecycles.

We'd Love to Talk to You if You Have

0-2 years of experience delivering interface design solutions for web or mobile applications A background/knowledge in graphic design or codingA demonstrated capacity and eagerness to learn and progress professionally in the

UX design field

Critical-thinking and problem-solving skills. *Be ready to show us some examples! Detail oriented and willing to learn Excellent communication skills

Our Culture

As we've already mentioned, we're rather passionate about our work here at Anatta. But we're also passionate about making work seem well, less like work. A big part of that comes from hiring the right people. We aren't looking for the first resum that checks off all the skills we need, but for a person who will feel as at home at Anatta as we do.

So, before you introduce yourself to us, we thought we'd introduce Anatta to you

We aren't corporate, and we never will be. There are just over 40 people working for Anatta, and we don't have plans to grow much beyond 60 in the future.

That's because we're about quality, not quantity, and we believe the surest way to be the best is to build a crack team of motivated, talented people doing work they love. We don't want to dilute that by hiring thousands of people, and we don't want to inherit the corporate culture that seems to infiltrate companies of a certain size.

We believe part of what makes Anatta awesome (if you'll pardon us for showing off for a moment), is that we combine many of the best bits of both big and small companies.

At Anatta, as in leading corporations, you'll be exposed to some of the best brands out there, working with some seriously cool products and tech on high-profile, high-impact projects. But just like a startup, you'll be able to get things done quickly, and you'll be given lots of responsibility and autonomy from day one: If we hire you, we trust you.

We're big believers in diversity, too. Of those 40+ employees we mentioned, we have people from Mexico, Ukraine, Singapore, Korea, England, Peru, and more. We also built Anatta to be deliberately flat, meaning everyone has access to everyone else including our CEO.

In fact (and it may be a little bit of a clich), we really do like to think of ourselves as one big family. If you give us your best, we'll give you ours in return. The success of Anatta rests on the people we employ, so we take great care to make sure they're happy, stimulated, and motivated. We also provide extensive training and certification sponsorship to make sure you're always moving in the right direction in your career.

You may have noticed a lot of our clients operate in the health / wellness space. That's because these industries are close to our hearts. There's no requirement to take up triathlon or pole vault in your spare time, but we're always running one wellness initiative or another, so an interest in healthy living is a bonus.

Lastly, let us say this: our culture isn't something we prescribe. We want to make sure you're going to love your time with Anatta, but this section you're reading right now is about more than that.

Sure, we want you to come on board and be a part of our culture. But we also want you to help shape it moving forwards. Just as we never stand still in our quest to remain at the cutting edge in ecommerce solutions, we're also constantly trying to make Anatta an even more magnificent place to work each day. If you have ideas about what makes a company culture special, Anatta is a place where you can turn those ideas into a reality.

What are the Benefits of working at Anatta?

With offices in Bangalore, Charleston and Los Angeles, we are a fun and diverse team of highly-driven individuals who experience and share deep joy for our work and the contributions we make in the world. When you work for Anatta, you get to be a part of that too!

On the slightly more tangible side, we also offer:

3% 401(k) contributionsUnlimited sick daysCompany-sponsored medical plansHealthy snack and drink options in office (mostly from Thrive Market)Cutting-edge technology (both hardware and software)Annual company retreatsRegular team events, group dinners, tripsA broad range of sponsored training programs for all roles

Next Steps

We wanted this job description to give you as much of an insight as possible into what it might be like to work for Anatta. If you think you're a good fit for the team and have the skills we're looking for, we're very much looking forward to hearing from you. Please apply below and we'll get to your application as soon as we can.

Description

Automation Anywhere is a global leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), empowering customers to automate end-to-end business processes with software bots  digital workers that perform repetitive and manual tasks, resulting in dramatic productivity gains, optimized customer experience and more engaged employees. The company offers the industry leading web-based and cloud-native intelligent automation platform combining RPA, artificial intelligence, machine learning and analytics right out of the box, to help organizations rapidly start and scale their process automation journey. Its Bot Store is the world's first and largest marketplace with more than 850 pre-built, intelligent automation solutions. With a global network of 1,900 partners, Automation Anywhere has deployed over 2.1 million bots to support some of the worlds largest enterprises across all industries. For additional information, visit www.automationanywhere.com.

COME JOIN US

Do you want to change the world? Join us and shape how knowledge workers will adopt and leverage robotic process automation to transform life, business, and the global economy. At Automation Anywhere, we believe that people who have time to create, think, and discover build great companies. Our intelligent process robots transform the way businesses operate, delivering complex business and IT work across a range of processes including procure-to-play, quote-to-cash, HR administration, claims processing, and thousands of other front and back office processes.

How You Will Contribute

The job of a User Experience Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In a UX Designer role, youll take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for users around the world ranging from novice to sophisticated users. Achieving this goal requires that you collaborate closely with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design processfrom crafting user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.

We strive to learn and understand our users needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, visual designers, and technical designers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products unique capabilities and personalities.

What You Will Do

Help to define the user model, user experience, and user interface for Automation Anywhere products and features. Develop high level and/or detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas. Gauge the usability of new and existing products and making constructive suggestions for change.

YOU HAVE

3+ years of experience designing and shipping software user experiences. A portfolio of UX-focused work samples for web and mobile applications that demonstrate your design thinking.

AND

Experience collaborating with Product Management and Engineering counterparts. Experience conducting and / or partnering with UX Research to amplify research and design impact. Expertise with design tools (e.g. Sketch, Figma, Photoshop) to produce wireframes and high fidelity mockups. A good understanding of current web technologies such as html, css, javascript.

All unsolicited resumes submitted to any @automationanywhere.com email address, whether submitted by an individual or by an agency, will not be eligible for an agency fee.

Company Description

McFadyen Digital is the leading advisor and implementer of eCommerce marketplace solutions. During 15 years of implementing marketplaces, weve built dozens of platforms that cumulatively generate billions of dollars of GMV. Were honored to have served 10% of the Fortune 500. Over 250 global brands like ABB, AB InBev, ACCO, Albertsons, American Red Cross, American Eagle Outfitters, US Army, US Agriculture Dept, (and many more letters in the alphabet) have entrusted their digital transformations to McFadyen. We operate global offices across the US, Brazil, and India.

Learn more about us at our website: www.mcfadyen.com

Job Description

If you have what it takes to simplify business goals and meet user needs, we should talk!

McFadyen Digital is known for providing intuitive and creative UX solutions for eCommerce. Our UX team research, discover and create solutions for business problems by understanding our clients.

At McFadyen Digital, we believe in flexible thinking when it comes to business strategy, design, and problem-solving. Our solutions are based on qualitative research, rapid prototyping, and business value analysis in an agile delivery environment.

As a UX Designer, Youll Get To
Work along with teams of managers, business analysts, and developers Act as an end-user advocate Help the client understand the value of end-users to their business Work in a collaborative, transparent, ego-free culture where your expertise is valued over your title Be a part of an organization where freedom of exploring technology and innovation are nurtured.  Qualifications
4 to 6 years in UX Designing Excellent communication skills, ability to express yourself both in person and on paper Extensive business and client management skills Exceptional creativity and innovation Understanding of tools and concepts around human-centered design Experience in user testing, storytelling, and translating between business and technical language Strong business awareness: ability to relate, understand, apprehend concepts, and interpret client/user needs Create rapid, iterative, and low-fi and hi-fi prototypes An understanding of the most modern trends and their role within a business environment. Excellent time management and organizational skills Professional approach to time, costs, and deadlines Extensive knowledge in using design tools like - Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma. Create professional presentations using dynamic elements, such as videos, visually represented data, and interactive modules. 

Qualifications
Professional Degree in Design like  Fine arts, Designing etc. Certifications in UX from reputed colleges or online course providers 

Bonus Skills
Strong grasp of HTML & CSS Good experience in scoping and estimating activities along with proposal development (LOE, SOW, and design proposals) Expertise in using animation tools Experience with UX in an agile development environment 

Note

Please share your portfolio while applying for this position.

Additional Information

Your Core Values: Integrity, Motivation, Leadership, Proactive, Team-Player

To Apply: We value smart, creative individuals who are multi-dimensional thinkers and thrive on professional development. Superb competence and continual improvement are key goals for everyone at McFadyen Solutions. This is an exciting opportunity with tremendous growth potential for someone who is focused on excellence. Your portfolio should impress us with great skills and conceptual problem-solving. We seek people who can demonstrate both compelling form and technical accuracy. Tell us why you would be a great addition to our team.

McFadyen Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable.

Introduction
Thomas J. Watson said it best: Good design is good business. Visualization is critical to discovering data-driven insights and effectively communicating that knowledge to others. Designers at IBM work to create experiences that work together, work the same, and work for our clients. Does the thought of creating the platform at the heart of solutions like Watson, Blockchain, IoT, and Security excite you? If so, read on!

Your Role and Responsibilities
As a User Experience Designer, you will
 Work in an Agile environment (with Product Owners, Requirement Managers, Developers, QA) to define requirements and design the solution, depending on the project.  Design intuitive and simple user interfaces for web and mobile solutions, producing journey maps, storyboards, mock-ups.  Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.  Design UI for Mobile and Web applications with special focus on Data Visualizations.  Innovate with evolving customer experience in terms of applying technologies and business models  Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas  Join our Enterprise Operations organization in providing a great user experience for our Tools & Technology wing.  In this position, you will be challenged to understand business needs as well as users perspectives and put them in a cohesive design which is simple but elegant. You will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to have a best user experience, iterate upon in accordance with user testing. 

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
 Minimum 4-5 years of experience as UX Designer (and/or Interaction Designer, Information Architect) with experience working with internal or external stakeholders.  Demonstrated expertise of using Design tools like Sketch, Invision or similar tools e.g., Adobe, Balsamiq, Framer etc.  Experience in designing tools or applications to support Sales or Marketing projects with focus on dashboard, data visualizations.  At least 4 years of experience of working in an agile environment with developers implementing designs  Portfolio of previous work must be presented incorporating UI designs and/or sketches that demonstrate an understanding of wireframing, interaction design, visual design and design best practices. 

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise
 Proven Soft skills in written and verbal  You love collaborative environments that use agile methodologies to encourage creative design thinking and find innovative ways to develop with cutting edge technologies  Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals and with creative approach to work  Intuitive individual with an ability to manage change and proven time management  Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed  Up-to-date technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications 

About Business Unit

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when youre looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities  where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust  where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM

IBMs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Senior UX Designer, Ola Electric
As the Experience Design team of Ola, we strive to craft memorable experiences for our users across all touchpoints, digital or physical. We believe that experiences are multi-sensorial and evolve over time as users interact with Ola across all our services. We work across platforms and businesses: Mobility (services, electric vehicles, fleet management), Food and Money. We are able to achieve this by integrating multiple functions of design: user experience research, product design, brand design, marketing design and content strategy into one Experience Design team.The Personal Mobility experience team is reimagining software UX for urban mobility. We are creating a thoughtful, highly personalized riding experience for riders across the globe. We are also working on building a scalable design platform that is able to support rapidly evolving businesses while embracing a diverse set of users. As a team, we are used to crafting digital products across multiple form factors, including smart vehicles and personal devices.
Whatll you do?
Work closely with product and engineering to identify and solve big challenges in experiences of our personal mobility vehicles.Partner closely with our UX research teams to spend a huge chunk of your time with riders across the globe to understand them, their needs, and their dreams.Design software experiences spanning across form factors: smart vehicles, charging stations, mobile devices, and more.Be responsible for ensuring design quality and coherence while prioritizing on impact through design.Collaborate with other designers in internal forums to push the experience quality bar higher.Talk to anyone within and outside the design team in order to get the solution shipped.Sketches, wireframes, mocks, animations, prototypes: whatever it takes to bring your ideas to life.Love and thrive in the organised chaos that is Ola!

Who are we looking for?
Ola is for the goers and the getters, the makers and make-it-happeners, the doers and the do-it-yourselfers.Designers with 3+ years of experience shipping great customer-facing digital products.Brownie points for being an EV enthusiast.
